10 WNI Ditahan di Malaysia terkait Aktivitas Penyelundupan Imigran
06 Nov 2019, 17:24 by Novi Christiastuti
Kuala Lumpur - Sedikitnya 10 warga negara Indonesia (WNI) ditangkap otoritas Malaysia terkait dugaan aktivitas penyelundupan imigran. Para WNI yang ditahan itu diyakini sebagai imigran ilegal di Malaysia.
Seperti dilaporkan kantor berita Malaysia, Bernama, Rabu (6/11/2019), kesepuluh WNI itu ditangkap oleh Badan Penegakan Maritim Malaysia (MMEA) pada Senin (4/11) malam waktu setempat. Kapal yang mereka tumpangi untuk meninggalkan perairan Malaysia dicegat oleh personel MMEA.
Pencegatan dilakukan di wilayah Tanjung Ayam Selatan, yang berjarak 3,6 mil laut atau sekitar 6,6 kilometer dari perairan Pengerang, Johor.
Direktur MMEA untuk Zona Tanjung Sedili, Kapten Maritim Mohd Zulfadli Nayan, menyebut seluruh tersangka yang ditahan berusia antara 14 tahun hingga 43 tahun. Identitas mereka tidak diungkap ke publik.
Disebutkan oleh Mohd Zulfadli bahwa 10 WNI itu tidak memiliki dokumen identitas yang valid. Terdapat satu nakhoda atau operator kapal dan satu wanita di antara para WNI yang ditahan.
Lebih lanjut, Mohd Zulfadli mengimbau para WNI yang ingin datang ke Malaysia atau pulang ke negara asalnya agar menggunakan jalur legal tanpa perlu mempertaruhkan nyawa mereka.
Ini merupakan kesekian kalinya WNI ditangkap di perairan Malaysia. Sebelumnya pada 9 Oktober, 15 Oktober dan 16 Oktober lalu, total 17 WNI ditangkap otoritas Malaysia karena kedapatan hendak meninggalkan wilayah negara itu dengan kapal secara ilegal. Diketahui bahwa Surat Edaran Pelabuhan No 67/2017 membatasi kapal-kapal asing melakukan aktivitas di perairan Malaysia. Beberapa WNI itu juga diketahui tidak memiliki izin tinggal yang sah dan overstaying di Malaysia.

10 Indonesian Citizens Detained in Malaysia over Immigrant Smuggling Activities
Nov 6 2019, 17:24 by Novi Christiastuti
Kuala Lumpur - At least 10 Indonesian citizens (WNI) were arrested by Malaysian authorities in connection with alleged immigrant smuggling activities. The detained Indonesian citizens are believed to be illegal immigrants in Malaysia.
As reported by the Malaysian news agency, Bernama, Wednesday (11/06/2019), the ten Indonesian citizens were arrested by the Malaysian Maritime Enforcement Agency (MMEA) on Monday (4/11) evening local time. The ship they were traveling in to leave Malaysian waters was intercepted by MMEA personnel.
The interception was carried out in the South Tanjung Ayam region, which is 3.6 nautical miles or around 6.6 kilometers from Pengerang waters, Johor.
The MMEA Director for the Tanjung Sedili Zone, Maritime Captain Mohd Zulfadli Nayan, said all detained suspects were between 14 years and 43 years old. Their identity is not revealed to the public.
Mohd Zulfadli said that the 10 Indonesians did not have valid identity documents. There was one skipper or boat operator and one woman among the Indonesian citizens who were detained.
Furthermore, Mohd Zulfadli appealed to citizens who want to come to Malaysia or return to their home countries to use legal channels without risking their lives.
This is the umpteenth time an Indonesian citizen was captured in Malaysian waters. Previously on October 9, October 15 and October 16, a total of 17 Indonesian citizens were arrested by Malaysian authorities because they were found wanting to leave the country's territory by boat illegally. It is known that Circular Letter No. 67/2017 restricts foreign vessels from carrying out activities in Malaysian waters. Some Indonesian citizens are also known to have no valid residence permits and overstaying in Malaysia.
